Substantive Crime.definition: a crime that does not have as an element the performance of some other crime
Substantive Crime.origin: [indicted and convicted of conspiracy to attempt to enter the bank and the substantive crime of attempting to enter the bank " United States v. Clay , 495 F.2d 700 (1974)"]

1.1: a crime that does not have as an element the performance of some other crime
